The TLP organization claims two supporters died and 50 were injured since Thursday. Authorities have blocked roads and cut internet services to prevent the demonstration.

description: Jyoti Singh, wife of Bhojpuri actor Pawan Singh, met Prashant Kishor, denying any political aspirations. She stated her visit aimed to advocate for women facing injustice, not to seek an election ticket. Kishor confirmed her focus on personal safety and experiences, with Jan Suraaj offering support for her security.  Recent marital tensions with Pawan Singh have been highlighted.

description: BMW Group India has recorded its best-ever January-September performance, selling 11,978 cars with a 13% rise. The July-September quarter saw a significant 21% jump. Demand for long wheelbase models and SUVs surged, while electric vehicle sales exploded by 246%, making EVs 21% of total car sales. BMW Motorrad also saw robust motorcycle sales.

Kabul bombing: Taliban terms it 'provocative act' by Pak; sends big warning from Indian soil
description: Afghanistan's Taliban government has accused Pakistan of bombing a border town and violating its sovereignty, following explosions in Kabul.  Meanwhile, India and Afghanistan declared Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism a shared threat.  New Delhi will upgrade its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy, and Kabul assured India it won't allow its territory to be used against Indian interests.

title: Ancient fungi shaped Earth’s first ecosystems billions of years before plants
description: New research reveals fungi, not plants, were Earth's first land colonizers, emerging hundreds of millions of years earlier. These ancient fungi partnered with algae, recycled nutrients, and built proto-soils, stabilizing surfaces and releasing essential elements. This groundbreaking discovery shows fungi created the foundational ecosystems that paved the way for plants and all terrestrial life.

Nobel Peace Prize 2025: Trump lost - why the defeat will sting Pakistan more
description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her efforts to promote democracy. Donald Trump, heavily backed by Pakistan for the prize, was snubbed despite his self-promotion and claims of peacemaking. Pakistan’s public support for Trump now appears diplomatically costly. The Nobel Committee stressed that lobbying holds no sway, favouring enduring peace efforts over rhetoric and self-congratulation.

description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado wins the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize, bolstering US President Trump's tough stance against Nicolas Maduro's regime. The award highlights democratic values and human rights, providing Trump with ideological backing for potential escalated actions against alleged authoritarianism and drug trafficking in Venezuela.

description: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted Pakistan-sponsored cross-border terrorism as a shared threat during talks with Afghan counterpart Amir Khan Muttaqi. He stressed coordinated efforts against terrorism, noting Afghanistan's sensitivity to India's security concerns. Muttaqi affirmed Afghanistan's commitment against elements threatening others and praised India's humanitarian aid.

title: 'Will expand circle of peace': Netanyahu says Israeli forces remain in Gaza until Hamas disarms
description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced an expansion of peace efforts as a ceasefire with Hamas commenced. He stated that hostages would be returned soon and Israeli forces would remain in Gaza to ensure Hamas disarms. Thousands of displaced Palestinians began returning home following the agreement, which was facilitated by talks in Egypt and a US peace plan.

title: 166 streetlight poles spraying mist: Delhi’s new weapon against winter pollution
'Trained engineer': Venezuela's Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize - what’s her academic background?
description: María Corina Machado, a Venezuelan industrial engineer and opposition leader, has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her relentless fight for democracy against authoritarian rule. Her journey from academia to activism reflects a fusion of technical precision and civic courage. Founder of Súmate and leader of Vente Venezuela, Machado has endured persecution, exile, and political bans. Her engineering mindset underpins her approach to governance, showing that democracy, like any system, requires constant, principled maintenance.

Brits' brilliant century against New Zealand in the World Cup solidified her as a key player, showcasing her resilience and ability to perform under pressure.

description: Pandalam Palace representatives are demanding a thorough investigation into how gold sheets, gifted by Vijay Mallya in 1998 for the Sabarimala Dwarapalaka idol, allegedly turned non-gold by 2019. They question the capability of repair sponsors and the negligence in procedures, urging accountability for those involved in the temple's upkeep.

His dedication, evident in his viral morning routine, has led to an estimated net worth of $2 million by 2025. Hall's journey from aspiring NFL player to fitness mogul highlights the power of discipline and entrepreneurship.

Nobel snub: Donald Trump misses out on Peace Prize - why he lost
description: Venezuelan pro-democracy leader Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her unwavering fight against Nicolás Maduro's regime and her advocacy for free elections. The committee's decision, made prior to any recent geopolitical events, firmly excludes US President Donald Trump, who had expressed expectations for the award. Machado's courage in the face of persecution inspires millions.

Microsoft engineer quits: emails thousands of staff; says can't enable war
description: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

Ayesha backs Steph Curry’s new venture amid marriage controversy
description: Ayesha Curry publicly supported husband Stephen Curry's new bar, 'The Eighth Rule,' but fans remain critical of her recent podcast comments about not wanting marriage or children. Despite her proud declaration of wanting to marry a 'bourbon man,' online reactions highlight lingering anger over her perceived disrespect towards the NBA star, with many questioning her shifting sentiments.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
description: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: Alexis Ohanian: My mom was undocumented—she could’ve been deported
description: Alexis Ohanian, husband of Serena Williams, spoke out against recent ICE arrests, sharing his personal connection as the son of an undocumented immigrant. He emphasized the importance of "smart borders and humane immigration reform" that includes a fair legalization plan, rather than breaking up families.

title: DCC’s Kelli Finglass returns with empowering message in Mississippi
description: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders director Kelli Finglass headlined Forrest Health's Spirit of Women luncheon in Hattiesburg, sharing a message of empowerment and resilience. The event, themed "The Grit Behind the Glam," celebrated women's strength and perseverance.  Finglass's keynote speech, reflecting on her leadership journey, deeply resonated with attendees, marking a significant comeback for the annual gathering.
